# ElizaOS Weekly Newsletter
**Week of October 28 - November 3, 2025**

## Executive Summary
This week has been pivotal for the ElizaOS ecosystem with significant developments on multiple fronts. The upcoming token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS is now scheduled to begin November 7th with a 90-day window for holders to complete the transition. Meanwhile, Eliza Labs has continued to expand their agent lineup with Otaku, a new web-based DeFi agent currently in beta testing, complementing the existing Spartan agent for Discord/Telegram. Core development has advanced with new entity-level security features and runtime enhancements that will strengthen our platform's foundation.

## Development Updates

### Core Infrastructure
- **Entity-Level Security**: The team is implementing entity-level row-level security (RLS) to enhance data protection across the platform. This hierarchical structure will connect multiple entities to multiple servers that connect to a single database, providing more granular access control.
- **Agent Settings Persistence**: A critical bug that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts has been fixed, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now properly retained.
- **ElizaOS Runtime Reference**: A new pull request has been opened to add an ElizaOS reference to the runtime, enabling plugins to access the unified messaging API for standardized communications.
- **Performance Enhancements**: New issues have been created to plan for parallel actions and background tasks, signaling upcoming improvements to system performance and responsiveness.

### Plugin Ecosystem
- **Bedrock Plugin Troubleshooting**: Users reported issues with the Bedrock plugin for image generation. The team is investigating the "Malformed input request" error and has suggested alternative plugins (OpenAI or OpenRouter) as temporary workarounds.
- **Repository Tracking**: GitHub data from elizaOS and elizaOS-plugins organizations has been gathered to improve repository activity tracking, with plans to automate tracking of new activity instead of using manual pipeline configuration.

## Community Spotlight

### Agent Development & Testing
The community has been actively testing and providing feedback on Eliza's newest agents:

- **Otaku DeFi Agent**: Currently in beta testing, this web-based agent is designed for cryptocurrency and DeFi interactions. Users have reported issues with outdated token price data and LP staking functionality, which the team is working to address. Otaku will soon be open-sourced as part of Eliza's ecosystem.
- **Spartan**: This Discord/Telegram agent continues to serve a different audience than Otaku, with the team clarifying that they are completely different products targeting different use cases.
- **Agent Production Plans**: Borko shared that the team plans to ramp up agent production over the next 6 months, expanding the ElizaOS agent ecosystem significantly.

### Community Discussions
- **XCP Asset Management**: Community member Rabbidfly proposed a multi-agent architecture with wallet, escrow, and trade agents to simplify XCP asset trading, outlining a four-step flow from wallet initialization to trade conclusion with escrow protection.
- **NFT Engagement Systems**: There's been enthusiastic discussion around creating anime otaku avatars using technology similar to "warplet NFT gen" on Farcaster, with ideas for NFT breeding/spawning mechanisms and LLM-generated game items.

## Token Economics

### AI16Z to ELIZAOS Migration
- **Migration Timeline**: Beginning November 7th, token holders will have a 90-day window to migrate from AI16Z to ELIZAOS.
- **Supply Changes**: Total supply will increase from 6.6 billion to 11 billion tokens (+40%), with circulating supply immediately increasing from 6.6 billion to 7.4 billion (13% increase).
- **Tokenomics Breakdown**: 75% to community (60% swapped from original AI16Z holders), 15% to SAFT, 10% to team and contributors.
- **Migration Process**: EOA wallet holders will need to manually migrate using a portal that will be announced in official channels. Exchanges have been notified but may not all support automatic migration.

### Value Accrual Mechanisms
- Value will accrue to the token through multiple revenue streams including Eliza cloud revenue (for buybacks, LP depth, and contributor rewards), OTC agent desk, x402, and ERC-8004 products.
- Long-term value will come from burns and fee integration as the AI agent economy grows.

## Coming Soon

### Eliza Cloud & Integration
- The Eliza cloud release is being prepared for demonstration at the upcoming Devconnect event.
- An x402 gateway that integrates with DegenAI is in development.
- The team is collaborating with the Ethereum Foundation on ERC-8004 for on-chain integration of the cloud.
- x402.elizaos.ai will serve as a central hub for APIs rather than listing partner agents.

### New Features & Agents
- Otaku Farcaster miniapp is in development, dependent on Coinbase integration, expected to launch next week.
- A points/leaderboard system is being planned to enhance community engagement.
- The team is exploring ways to implement parallel actions and background tasks to improve system performance.

## Resources
- Keep an eye on the official announcements channel for the upcoming token migration portal link
- For technical issues with the Bedrock plugin, check out the [support channel](https://discord.com/channels/1300025221834739744)
- Learn more about entity-level RLS through issue [#6112](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/6112)
- Track the implementation of unified messaging in PR [#6111](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/6111)
- Follow the repository tracking improvements in PR [#169](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaOS.github.io/pull/169)

Stay connected with the ElizaOS community as we continue building the future of AI agents together!

- Merge pull request for plugin-evm (PR #24) (mentioned by cjft)

- Try alternative image generation plugins (mentioned by 0xbbjoker)

### Documentation Tasks

### Feature Requests

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-02

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Otaku DeFi Agent Beta Testing
- Eliza's new DeFi agent Otaku is currently in beta testing
- Users reported issues with outdated token price data and problems with LP staking functionality
- Team acknowledged these issues and promised to address them
- Otaku will soon be open-sourced as part of Eliza's ecosystem

### Token Migration and Economics
- Upcoming token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS scheduled for November 7th
- Migration portal will be provided for token holders
- Team clarified that AI16Z tokens won't be terminated after migration but liquidity may be limited
- Discussion about market cap equivalence between old and new tokens

### Platform Development
- Eliza Cloud was described as a consumer platform for creating, deploying, and interacting with AI agents without coding
- Team is working on database architecture improvements with Row-Level Security (RLS) based on Entities
- PR #6107 implements a hierarchical structure where multiple entities connect to multiple servers that connect to a single database
- Technical issues with plugin connections being addressed, including timeout problems and error handling

### NFT and Engagement Systems
- Discussion about creating anime otaku avatars using technology similar to "warplet NFT gen" on Farcaster
- Ideas for NFT breeding/spawning mechanisms where accounts can stake coins together
- Concepts for LLM-generated game items with attributes and lore
- Team noted they need to focus on shipping current products before implementing new ideas

### XCP Asset Management Solution
- Frustrations expressed about complex XCP (Counterparty) asset trading process
- Proposal for a multi-agent architecture with wallet, escrow, and trade agents to simplify transactions
- Four-step flow outlined from wallet initialization to trade conclusion with escrow protection
- Stretch goals include social media integration, multi-wallet support, and Emblem vault integration

### Social Media Challenges
- Several users expressed concerns about Eliza's suspended X (Twitter) accounts
- Team explained there's an ongoing lawsuit where X is demanding $50k monthly payments
- Discussion about alternative platforms like Farcaster and Nostr as potential alternatives to X

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Is Otaku a product of Eliza Labs?**  
A: "Yup this is Eliza's newest flagship agent" (answered by Borko)

**Q: Is Eliza Cloud the same as Otaku?**  
A: "No, Eliza Cloud is a consumer platform where anyone can create, deploy, and interact with AI agents without touching code or infrastructure" (answered by Borko)

**Q: Is Otaku part of open source?**  
A: "Otaku will soon be made open source" (answered by Borko)

**Q: What about degenai?**  
A: "Degen is being planned out, will have more updates later" (answered by Borko)

**Q: What's the lawsuit with X (Twitter) about?**  
A: "Making elizaOS pay $50k a month" (answered by witch)

**Q: Does new token will be equal market cap with old one?**  
A: "If it's not there's an arb opportunity and likely market will fix" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: After end of migration ai16z will be terminated?**  
A: "No but I imagine there won't be a lot of supply to do much with" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: What happens if I hold ai16z tokens in phantom wallet?**  
A: "We'll have a migration site" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: Is this just adding a serverId to the messages table?**  
A: "No, that was the first PR (#6101). This second PR permits adding a second level of RLS based on Entities." (answered by Stan ⚡)

**Q: What was the warplet NFT generation system on Farcaster?**  
A: "It was created by someone named Sayangel with 'harmonybot' and a coin called $chaos, taking a fingerprint of Farcaster accounts to generate avatars" (answered by DorianD)

## Community Help & Collaboration

### Otaku Agent Troubleshooting
- **Helper:** sayonara | **Helpee:** neerg  
  **Context:** Otaku agent providing incorrect/outdated token prices  
  **Resolution:** sayonara acknowledged the issue and promised to tune the prompt

- **Helper:** Borko | **Helpee:** hildi  
  **Context:** User's USDC disappeared after attempting LP staking with Otaku  
  **Resolution:** Borko offered to fix the issue via DM

- **Helper:** sayonara | **Helpee:** hildi  
  **Context:** User's USDC disappeared after attempting LP staking with Otaku  
  **Resolution:** sayonara explained LP staking isn't available yet and requested wallet address to investigate

### Technical Support
- **Helper:** Stan ⚡ | **Helpee:** sayonara  
  **Context:** Plugin MCP connection not holding/disconnecting  
  **Resolution:** Stan identified multiple root causes (timeout issues, limited ping retries, no error handling) and suggested specific fixes including adjusting timeouts, increasing retries, and changing ping methods

### XCP Asset Trading Solution
- **Helper:** Rabbidfly | **Helpee:** DorianD  
  **Context:** DorianD expressed frustration with complex XCP asset trading process  
  **Resolution:** Rabbidfly proposed a multi-agent architecture with wallet, escrow, and trade agents to simplify the process, outlining a four-step flow and potential stretch goals

### NFT Engagement Ideas
- **Helper:** shaw | **Helpee:** DorianD  
  **Context:** DorianD suggested creating anime otaku avatars similar to warplets  
  **Resolution:** Shaw validated the idea and expanded on it, suggesting they could create high-quality NFTs using profile pictures as input

- **Helper:** DorianD | **Helpee:** shaw  
  **Context:** Shaw mentioned difficulty in branding elizaOS compared to ai16z  
  **Resolution:** DorianD suggested gamification mechanics involving staking and breeding NFTs to enhance engagement

## Action Items

### Technical
- Fix Otaku's data retrieval for token prices and market caps (Mentioned by neerg)
- Investigate and resolve the issue with disappearing USDC during LP staking attempts (Mentioned by hildi)
- Implement the token migration portal for November 7th (Mentioned by Dr. Neuro)
- Open-source the Otaku agent (Mentioned by Borko)
- Continue development of DegenAI (Mentioned by Borko)
- Adjust plugin MCP connection settings (ping timeout, retries, reconnection attempts) (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Test client on plugin-MySQL with new serverId implementation (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Review PR #6107 implementing entity-based RLS (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Develop XCP wallet agent that can accept private keys (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-01

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration to ElizaOS
- Migration of AI16Z to ElizaOS begins November 7th with a 90-day window for token holders
- Supply will increase from 6.6 billion to 11 billion tokens (+40%)
- Circulating supply will immediately increase from 6.6 billion to 7.4 billion (13% increase)
- Tokenomics breakdown: 75% to community (60% swapped from original AI16Z holders), 15% to SAFT, 10% to team and contributors
- Migration will require using a portal that will be announced in official channels
- Exchanges have been notified but may not all support automatic migration

### Development Updates
- Eliza cloud release is being prepared for demonstration at Devconnect
- Team is developing an x402 gateway that integrates with DegenAI
- Ongoing research for on-chain integration of the cloud in collaboration with Ethereum Foundation around ERC-8004
- x402.elizaos.ai will serve as a central hub for APIs rather than listing partner agents
- Otaku Farcaster miniapp is in development, dependent on Coinbase integration, expected to launch next week
- Some x402 resource servers contain malicious code that needs fixing

### Technical Implementations
- Discussion about suppressing Bootstrap on custom slash commands in ElizaOS
- Current implementation uses a patch-based approach to prevent LLM from responding to specific commands (/f, /fl, /fc)
- Implementation involves patching the Telegram plugin to check for a custom flag

### Cryptocurrency Assets
- Conversation about Rare Pepes and Fake Rares on the counterparty platform
- Discussion about creating assets like PEPEPIZZA and potential subassets

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Do we need to do anything for migration? Or just hold spot and it will automatically migrate?**  
A: You'll need to use the migration portal that will be announced.

**Q: The bridge is not snapshot based? Manual swap?**  
A: Yes, it will be a manual swap.

**Q: Will Bybit support rebranding?**  
A: We've notified exchanges and hope they will support by automatically migrating holders on their exchange, but if not you will need to migrate manually using the portal.

**Q: Last date for migration is 7 Nov!?**  
A: Start of migration is then, and you'll have 90 days to migrate.

**Q: Will Jupiter dex migrate automatically?**  
A: Jupiter Wallet is self custody wallet, migration is through portal, migration starts Nov 7th.

**Q: If I have token in bybit, will it auto convert?**  
A: Exchanges are notified about migration and hope they will support by automatically migrating holders on their exchange, but if not you will need to migrate manually using the portal.

**Q: Will there be changes to tokenomics after the migration?**  
A: Yes, detailed tokenomics breakdown was provided showing the new distribution.

**Q: Are we doing anything with $degenai on the rebrand?**  
A: We're still building on it, got an x402 gateway that takes DegenAI.

**Q: Is x402.elizaos.ai going to be used as the central hub for APIs?**  
A: Yes, we can use it for that purpose.

**Q: Otaku farcaster miniapp wen?**  
A: Coming soon; coinbase dependent. Next week if all goes well.

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Clarification**
   - Helper: Toni
   - Helpee: cryptogains
   - Context: User confused about tokenomics and migration ratio
   - Resolution: Toni provided detailed breakdown of the new tokenomics structure and supply changes

2. **Migration Portal Information**
   - Helper: Dr. Neuro
   - Helpee: Thomas
   - Context: User looking for migration portal and help channel
   - Resolution: Explained migration starts November 7th and directed to the migration questions channel

3. **Migration Date Confusion**
   - Helper: Kenk
   - Helpee: Kid Bengala
   - Context: Confusion about migration dates on Binance vs. announcements
   - Resolution: Shared official information clarifying that migration starts November 7th

4. **Cryptocurrency Asset Information**
   - Helper: Rabbidfly
   - Helpee: DorianD
   - Context: DorianD mentioned Rare Pepes and PEPEPIZZA assets but seemed out of the loop on current platforms
   - Resolution: Rabbidfly provided information about Rare Pepes vs Fake Rares, directed to pepe.wtf, mentioned freewallet and horizon.market for description changes, and easyasset.art for metadata changes

5. **Security Concern Resolution**
   - Helper: sayonara
   - Helpee: p0pps
   - Context: p0pps reported a user sending suspicious "seeds.rar" file
   - Resolution: sayonara banned the reported user

## Action Items

### Technical
- Prepare for token migration starting November 7th with 90-day migration window (Mentioned by Toni)
- Complete Eliza cloud release for demonstration at Devconnect (Mentioned by shaw)
- Develop Farcaster mini-app for analysis with freemium model (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Implement on-chain integration of the cloud (Mentioned by shaw)
- Continue collaboration with Ethereum Foundation on ERC-8004 (Mentioned by shaw)
- Launch otaku Farcaster miniapp after Coinbase integration (Mentioned by sayonara)
- Set up x402.elizaos.ai as central hub for APIs (Mentioned by witch)
- Complete migration following Binance announcement (Mentioned by shaw)
- Investigate proper method to suppress Bootstrap for custom slash commands in ElizaOS (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Fix cloudfare issue for Twitter agent (Mentioned by cryptochad7777)
- Fix malicious code in some x402 resource servers (Mentioned by Agent Joshua)

### Documentation
- Provide clear migration instructions for self-custody wallet users (Mentioned by Toni)
- Create detailed guide for the migration portal process (Mentioned by Dr. Neuro)
- Publish migration portal link in announcements channel when ready (Mentioned by Toni)

### Feature
- Implement Protocol Owned Liquidity with 275 million tokens (Mentioned by Toni)
- Create pepepizza.slice subassets (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Implement virtual pizza franchise for agents (Mentioned by DorianD)

# Discord Chat Analysis for 💬-coders Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily focused on ElizaOS development and plugin issues. A user named fermartz reported problems with the Bedrock plugin when generating images, receiving a "Malformed input request" error despite using the recommended `amazon.titan-image-generator-v2:0` model. 0xbbjoker attempted to help but couldn't reproduce the issue due to regional access limitations to the specific AWS model. They suggested debugging approaches including cloning and linking the plugin locally, and recommended alternatives like OpenAI or OpenRouter plugins for image generation. There was also a brief question about ElizaOS startup scripts, which was answered by Heisenberg who noted it's in the package.json file. Additionally, there was a question about x API functionality for agents, but this remained unanswered.

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 2 - 8, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's activity focused on initiating new features and planning for future enhancements. Development began on core security and runtime improvements, with new pull requests opened to implement entity-level row-level security and to add an ElizaOS reference to the runtime. Concurrently, several new issues were created to guide future work, focusing on core performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as user engagement with a points and leaderboard system. The period was characterized by laying the groundwork for upcoming features rather than completing existing ones.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
While no major features were completed this period, work was initiated on two key fronts through new pull requests:

-   **Security Framework:** A new pull request, [#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107), was opened to begin the implementation of entity-level row-level security (RLS). This work is complemented by a new issue, [#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112), opened for discussion on the same topic.
-   **Runtime Enhancements:** To improve the runtime environment, work was started in [#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111) to add an ElizaOS reference, a foundational step for future runtime capabilities.

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
No issues were closed this week. The focus was on opening new discussions to shape the project's direction.

-   **New & Active Issues:** Four significant new issues were opened, outlining key areas for future development:
    -   **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were started around improving the system's operational capabilities with proposals for "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)).
    -   **User Engagement & Security:** Future enhancements were proposed for user interaction via a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) and for data security with "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)).

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a focus on initiating new work streams through the opening of pull requests and issues. There were no specific details in the reports regarding high-volume discussions or collaborative reviews during this period.

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.
